creator: norma.hughes@sts.co.uk
text:
When specifying a number greater than 2 for the number-columns-spanned 
attribute of table-cell, I get a NULL error. Specifying 1 or 2 does not cause a 
problem.

Cannot reproduce the bug, the following fo fragment works like a charm for me in
fop 0.20.3 and fop 0.20.4:
<fo:table width="60mm" border="thin solid red">
	<fo:table-column width="20mm"/>
	<fo:table-column width="20mm"/>
	<fo:table-column width="20mm"/>
	<fo:table-body>
		<fo:table-row>
			<fo:table-cell number-columns-spanned="3" border="thin solid red">
				<fo:block>Table cell text</fo:block>
			</fo:table-cell>
		</fo:table-row>
	</fo:table-body>
</fo:table>
creator: oleg@tkachenko.com
norma.hughes@sts.co.uk
text:
Created attachment 2682
document gives null error because number-columns-spanned >2

The example sets up a three column table, then all in one row has:
<fo:table-cell number-columns-spanned="3">
  ...  
</fo:table-cell>
<fo:table-cell>
  <fo:block /> 
</fo:table-cell>
<fo:table-cell>
  <fo:block /> 
</fo:table-cell>

The last two table-cell elements shouldn't be there.
creator: Keith.Groves@Evolution.net
